content.text: To ensure full adherence to Indonesian national regulations governing private education institutions, maintain all required licenses and permits, integrate mandatory national curriculum components, and fulfill reporting obligations to the Ministry of Education, Culture, Research, and Technology (Kemendikdasmen).
Each Eduversal Partner School operates under a legally registered Yayasan (foundation) as the school owner and license holder, in accordance with Law No. 28 of 2004 concerning Foundations.

content.title: Key Obligations
items: Akta Pendirian (Deed of Establishment): Notarized foundation charter registered with the Ministry of Law and Human Rights.
NPWP Yayasan: Tax identification number for the foundation.
Annual Reporting: Submit annual activity and financial reports to the relevant authorities.
Asset Management: All school buildings, land, and facilities owned or controlled by the Yayasan.
Non-Profit Status: Operate exclusively for educational and social purposes; any surplus reinvested in educational quality.

content.title: Evidence Required
items: Notarized Akta Pendirian and any amendments.
Registration certificate from the Ministry of Law and Human Rights.
Annual financial statements audited by a registered accountant.

content.text: Each school level (PAUD, SD, SMP, SMA) must obtain and maintain an operational license from the local Education Office (Dinas Pendidikan Kabupaten/Kota or Provinsi).

steps.title: Application Submission
steps.desc: Completed application with supporting documents to local Dinas Pendidikan.

steps.title: Document Requirements
steps.desc: Yayasan legal documents, land ownership/lease documentation, building safety certificate, fire safety clearance, environmental health clearance, proposed curriculum and staffing plan, principal and teacher qualification documents.

steps.title: Site Inspection
steps.desc: Dinas team verifies facilities, safety, and readiness.

content.text: Renewal requires submission of updated documentation and compliance evidence 6 months before expiration.

content.title: Evidence Required
items: Current operational license (Izin Operasional) for each school level.
Inspection reports and corrective action records.

content.text: Every school must obtain a unique NPSN from the Ministry of Education as the official school identifier for all national reporting systems.

content.title: Purpose of NPSN
items: Eligibility for government programs and subsidies (if applicable).

steps.title: Submit Online
steps.desc: Via Dapodik system with school profile, operational license, and facility data.

content.text: Schools must keep NPSN data current in Dapodik and report any changes.
Dapodik is the Ministry's primary database for schools, students, teachers, and facilities, serving as the foundation for national education planning, funding allocation, and policy decisions.

content.title: Responsibilities
items: Designate a trained Dapodik Operator responsible for data entry.

Update data each semester (minimum): student enrollment and attendance, teacher and staff employment data, curriculum delivery and assessment results, facility and infrastructure inventory, financial data.
Synchronize data online with the national server.
Respond to validation errors and queries.

content.text: The principal must ensure the Dapodik Operator receives training and support, reviews data quality, and approves data submissions.

content.title: Timeline for Reporting
items: Semester 1 Cut-off: October 31st, sync by November 15.
Semester 2 Cut-off: April 30th, sync by May 15.
Ad hoc updates as required for critical changes.

content.title: Common Data Elements
items: Students: Name, NISN, birthdate, address, parent contact, enrollment date, class placement.
Teachers: Name, NIK, NUPTK, qualifications, subjects taught, employment status.
Curriculum: Subjects offered, teaching hours, assessment methods.
Facilities: Classrooms, labs, libraries, sports facilities, and condition.

content.title: Evidence Required
items: Dapodik Operator appointment letter and training certificates.
Data entry logs and synchronization receipts.
Validation reports and error correction documentation.
Annual Dapodik accuracy audit by GM or designated reviewer.

subsections.title: SIMPKB (Sistem Informasi Manajemen Pengembangan Keprofesian Berkelanjutan)

content.text: SIMPKB tracks teacher professional development activities and is linked to teacher certification and career progression.

content.title: Requirements
items: All certified teachers must maintain SIMPKB accounts.
Record all CPD activities: workshops, training, conferences, lesson study, action research.
Minimum CPD hours per year as mandated by regulations.

content.text: Schools must facilitate teacher access to SIMPKB, verify and endorse teacher CPD claims, and maintain school records of PD activities.

content.title: Evidence Required
items: SIMPKB activity logs for all certified teachers.
School PD calendar and attendance records.

content.text: Eduversal Partner Schools must integrate mandatory Indonesian national curriculum subjects and embrace the Profil Pelajar Pancasila competencies as outlined in Kurikulum National (Merdeka).

content.title: Mandatory National Subjects
items: Pendidikan Pancasila dan Kewarganegaraan (PPKn) - Minimum 2 hours/week.
Pendidikan Agama - Minimum 2-3 hours/week, grouped by religion.
Muatan Lokal (Mulok) - Local content reflecting local culture.

content.text: National subjects are taught in dedicated time blocks, using Indonesian as the language of instruction, and assessed using national frameworks.

content.title: Integration Approach
items: Bilingual reports for Cambridge and national curriculum subjects.
Typical weekly allocation: Cambridge subjects ~70%, National subjects ~25%, Co-curricular/enrichment ~5%.

content.text: Profil Pelajar Pancasila defines the competencies Indonesian students should develop, aligned with Pancasila values.

content.title: Six Dimensions of Profil Pelajar Pancasila
items: Beriman, Bertakwa kepada Tuhan Yang Maha Esa, dan Berakhlak Mulia (Faith, piety, and noble character).

content.text: The Profil Pelajar Pancasila program is delivered through the EduSTEAM approach, combining Indonesian national character competencies with international STEAM pedagogies.

content.title: Evidence Required
items: Project proposals with STEAM integration plans.
Student work portfolios documenting design and process.
Reflection rubrics tracking growth in all dimensions.

content.text: School calendars must align with the national academic calendar issued annually by the Ministry of Education while accommodating Cambridge examination schedules.

content.title: National Calendar Elements
items: Minimum 38 instructional weeks per year (excluding holidays and exams).

content.title: National Holidays and Observances
items: Religious holidays (Idul Fitri, Idul Adha, etc.).

content.text: Schools must meet minimum instructional hours per week as specified by national regulations.
Timetables must be designed to meet or exceed minimum hours, with both national and Cambridge subjects counting toward the total.

content.title: Evidence Required
items: Master timetable by grade and subject.
Calculation showing compliance with minimum hours.
Attendance records and instructional delivery logs.

subsections.title: Child Protection and Student Welfare Regulations

content.text: Schools must comply with national child protection laws and ensure a safe environment for all students.

content.title: Key Requirements
items: Written anti-bullying policy accessible to all students and families.
Clear reporting mechanisms for students, parents, and staff.
Prohibition of corporal punishment and positive behavior management.
Physical and psychological safety measures in place.

content.text: Schools must maintain a confidential incident log for suspected child abuse or neglect and cooperate with external investigations.

content.title: Evidence Required
items: Anti-bullying policy published in English and Bahasa Indonesia.
Training records for staff on child protection.

content.text: Schools must adhere to national staffing regulations and ensure all teachers meet minimum qualifications.

content.title: Minimum National Requirements
items: PAUD: Diploma IV (D-IV) or Bachelor's (S1) in Early Childhood Education.
SD: S1 in Primary Education or relevant subject + teaching credential.
SMP/SMA: S1 in subject area + teaching credential.

content.text: Schools must maintain a teacher qualification matrix and verify the authenticity of documents.

content.title: Evidence Required
items: Teacher qualification matrix with copies of degrees and transcripts.

content.text: Local and provincial education offices conduct periodic inspections to verify compliance with operational standards.
Schools must maintain inspection-ready documentation at all times and prepare for inspections.

content.title: Evidence Required
items: Inspection reports with findings and recommendations.

content.text: Schools must establish fair, transparent, and non-discriminatory tuition and fee structures.

content.title: Best Practices
items: Publish fee schedule annually in English and Bahasa Indonesia.
Provide scholarship or financial aid for qualifying families.
No hidden fees; all charges disclosed upfront.

content.text: Prohibited practices include arbitrary fee increases and withholding academic records for non-payment.
Schools must prepare for natural disasters and emergencies, ensuring safety protocols are in place.

content.title: Mandatory Elements
items: Emergency response plan with evacuation routes and assembly points.

content.text: Schools must maintain communication with families regarding emergency procedures.
Schools must implement health protocols as directed by the Ministry of Health and the Ministry of Education.

content.title: Compliance Areas
items: Capacity and distancing adjustments if required.

content.text: Schools must maintain communication with families regarding health measures.
Schools must comply with Indonesia's Personal Data Protection Law and ensure the privacy of student and staff data.
Schools must maintain a register of personal data processed and inform families about data usage.

subsections.title: Reporting Obligations to Yayasan and Eduversal

content.text: Schools must keep the local Yayasan informed of operational performance, financial status, and compliance.
To ensure compliance, GMs should use an annual checklist to track key obligations.

content.title: Checklist Items by Quarter
items: Q1: Check operational licenses, NPSN data, academic calendar, and staff training.
Q2: Administer ANBK, conduct mid-year financial review, and submit bi-annual reports.
Q3: Update SIMPKB, file tax returns, and review policy register.
Q4: Conduct graduation ceremonies, finalize enrollment for the next academic year, and prepare for accreditation visits.

content.text: Maintain a compliance portfolio for inspections and audits, including key legal and operational documents.

content.title: Data and Reporting Evidence
items: Bi-annual reports to Yayasan and Eduversal.

content.text: This section aligns with CIS and WASC standards, ensuring compliance with national education laws and regulations.
